item.title: OSI 7-Layer Model
item.description: The Open System Interconnection (OSI) model (defined in ISO 7498-1), which is a reference tool for understanding data communications between two networked systems, divides the communication processes into 7 layers: Physical layer Data link layer Network layer Transport layer Session layer Presentation layer Application layer Those layers break up the networks into manageable pioeces, which provides a common language to explain components and their functionalities. Here this article will give an overview of the 7 layers top-to-down.
